page.title: 12TRIP TO KINGLEY VALE
page.content:
A class of ten to eleven year olds went to Kingley Vale to see how many outdoor activities could be enjoyed in comparative safety.
The Nature Reserve Centre hut contained information about plant life, animals, birds and insects, and a nature trail was clearly marked and there were leaflets available at twenty pence each. (Price at date of visit - June l985)
The hut was the only man-made shelter available so we took raincoats.
An ancient Yew grove was ideal for tree climbing. Its history goes back to Viking times.
The Vale led on to a steeply wooded hill; the ground was slippery and
